title: Cassiopeia players, we're making progress!
body:
TL;DR--We all want the same thing. Be tough, not mean. Stashu is not evil and has some pretty good ideas we'll hopefully see after this set of changes goes live.

So [I've](http://i.imgur.com/wJ8Hp0U.jpg) been part of the Cass discussion for a while, and it seems a [good number of you guys](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/ygxuK4gR-quick-cassiopeia-update-re-pbe-and-421?comment=000a) [agree with me on some stuff](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/oljxsEnc-i-dislike-cassiopeias-stacking-passive?comment=00030000), so that's cool. I just wanted to make a quick thread to remind everyone what this is all about. Tensions are high, an awesome champ [took a baseball bat to the face](http://i.imgur.com/o22LOqf.gif) and left on the curb for a few months, and nobody is happy about it. We're not happy, Stashu's not happy, and I'm sure the other Rioters working with him aren't happy. This whole thing has been a damn [train wreck](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DO5O59EuXRo) since the beginning, but we're starting to get back on track and have our voices heard!

What's important to remember is that this isn't about [getting the entire rework reverted](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/ygxuK4gR-quick-cassiopeia-update-re-pbe-and-421?comment=000a00030000), or getting Stashu removed from the rework, or proving who was right all along about what identity fits Cass the best. We're all following these threads because we want Cassiopeia to be the best snake wizard lady she can be. We've all got the same goal in mind, and we could stand to be a bit more civil with each other.

Calling out Stashu when [he says something outrageous and disappears for half a week](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/ygxuK4gR-quick-cassiopeia-update-re-pbe-and-421?comment=001d0001)? I'm all for that. If he's not communicating enough, let him know repeatedly, and we get a night like yesterday where he was on for hours responding to multiple posts in multiple threads. Telling Stashu [to resign](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/ygxuK4gR-quick-cassiopeia-update-re-pbe-and-421?comment=001d000100050000) or [calling to have him removed](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/T5czn627-stashu) [from the rework](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/eRmscAd4-riot-can-anyone-other-than-stashu-rework-cassiopeia) because [he and the rest of Riot is incompetent](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/ygxuK4gR-quick-cassiopeia-update-re-pbe-and-421?comment=000a0003000000000000) and spouting that [Cass is dead](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/ygxuK4gR-quick-cassiopeia-update-re-pbe-and-421?comment=0059) because of him? Not as cool. That's not improving snake wizardry, that's causing a fuss and getting us nowhere.

EDIT: **To clarify, the following is not me saying the next Cass iteration is what we want, only that it's powerful, and we need to remember that this isn't about making Cass stronger, but about making Cass more fun (i.e. Less E focus, better passive, etc.)**

Also with the 4.21 changes coming out, I figure I'll give a quick forecast for those of you without PBE accounts. I think she'll be very, very strong in the right matchups. Like, [holy shiet](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ld2nWfIap2k) you have no idea. That poison amp on Twin Fang is so strong if you use it right and it's actually way more fun to manage than you'd think. A late game hyperscaling champ that can all-in you at level 3 with Q-E-E-Q-Ignite for a kill from near full HP? [That's not supposed to happen](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ULGaxScqbV4). Just remember that her being strong doesn't mean she's in a great place. There's still a ton of room for improvement.

The passive is still a [snake in her boot](http://i.imgur.com/h02JMZh.jpg), so to speak, but if Stashu's latest posts on the subject have been any indication, [it sounds like we'll be getting an actual gameplay passive to go along with the current one](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/8Vz3Nbpo-riotstashu-i-think-i-know-how-casss-passive-can-work-everyone-else-hear-me-out?comment=000200000000), or maybe even multiple gameplay passives that you unlock as you stack up. We may even see some 
[Petrifying Gaze tweaks](http://i.imgur.com/AU2VF.jpg) and [totally awesome Miasma buffs](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/8Vz3Nbpo-riotstashu-i-think-i-know-how-casss-passive-can-work-everyone-else-hear-me-out?comment=000200090000) in the package.

Anyway, keep up the good discussions, Cass players. I've played this game for nearly 5 years and I've seen every major rework since Katarina, and I've never seen a champion's community so united in making sure she's every bit as badass as she deserves to be.

[Scampy out.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PiUR9zf2mXk)

(If you've clicked all the links so far I hope they entertained you.  [This](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y9K18CGEeiI) [takes](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yCU9Z-4yDkE) [longer](http://gfycat.com/UnlinedColossalFrillneckedlizard) [than](https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=i_IqFsRwydw) [you'd](http://i.imgur.com/wgXV5sz.gif) [think](http://djbluewater.com/ThankYouForPlaying.jpg).

replies.body:
Personally, I've liked the direction of the rework ever since it came out. The implementation obviously left plenty to be desired, but as far as the intention-- a late game high DPS hypercarry mage who takes high mechanical skill-- I really like it. They basically turned her into one of those champions who feels like she can 1v5 if played properly, and those champions are always the most fun to play in my opinion. The PBE changes right now also look nice, but I'm really hoping that cass can soon take a break from having major kit changes each patch so I don't feel like I'm wasting my time learning the changes.

Opinions favoring the rework are obviously not popular, so I don't expect this post to be either. But I really do like the direction of the rework and hope to soon see Cassiopeia have a stable identity. I played cass a little before the rework but didn't really realize how much fun she was until afterwards. I really want to try and master her but it just feels as if there's no point if she's just going to keep being changed.

>I really want to try and master her but it just feels as if there's no point if she's just going to keep being changed.

Yeah I really worry about this. I want to keep improving the champion where possible, but, if the changes are dramatic they can really cause some of these sorts of problems.

I hope you stick with her through the changes, and I'll try to make any further changes laser-focused so as to fix problems without causing this sort of upheaval. Thanks for giving the update a chance!

While I do get his point, I dare say we're not at a point were old Cassiopeia mains are ready to sign the treaty.
Even with the PBE changes there's a lot to be critized (summary @bottom)

There have to be more changes to her core. It still is not about numbers, but about how the gameplay change effected her. It lacks sasisfaction and fun for many people.
---------------------------------
(E.g. Q is even less valuable on his own. Too heavy focus on E. Ult and W feel "unimpressive" and overnerfed. Passive seems to not add anything for big periods of time)

> There have to be more changes to her core. It still is not about numbers, but about how the gameplay change effected her which lacks satisfaction and fun for many people.

This. A trillion times this.

> While I do get his point, I dare say we're not at a point were old Cassiopeia mains are ready to sign the treaty.
> Even with the PBE changes there's a lot to be critized (summary @bottom)
> 
> There have to be more changes to her core. It still is not about numbers, but about how the gameplay change effected her. It lacks sasisfaction and fun for many people.

I agree completely - I just wanted to throw my voice to this as well. I'm not going to 'stick with' any kind of changes that I feel still have completely not addressed the core concerns that we have echoed over and over to seemingly deaf ears. 

Yes, there has been some reception, and 'changes' have been made. Impotent changes, but changes nonetheless. Enough to give me hope that the core problem could still be changed as well.

- "Old Cassiopeia Main"

> I hope you stick with her through the changes, and I'll try to make any further changes laser-focused so as to fix problems without causing this sort of upheaval. Thanks for giving the update a chance!

That's dispiriting.

[The problems with her rework is rooted deep within the very rework. Your rework is flawed on a fundamental level](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/E1kLKJaz-stashu-have-you-ever-considered-making-cassiopeia-not-revolve-around-twin-fangs-e?comment=000d) and you will not be able to salvage this with tiny laser-guided changes just so you can preserve her current play-style. Because her current design at it's very core IS the problem.



You took a sledgehammer to demolish her old kit when it was flawed (nobody honestly believed she was perfect), but satisfying. I'm sure she can be torn down a few more times to get right, atleast until she is what she is supposed to be rather than this AP brawler.


And again. [I really don't think you realize the problem with her rework.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/E1kLKJaz-stashu-have-you-ever-considered-making-cassiopeia-not-revolve-around-twin-fangs-e?comment=000d) It has nothing to do with how badly she sucks atm. If a champion is bad, just buff them, balancing is the easiest to resolve (relatively speaking). What many of us want is what made her fun to be preserved. Not...well...read the thread I linked to. Pay particularly close attention to point #1.
-----
Let me take other reworks to compare.

{{champion:14}} and {{champion:268}}.

BOTH champions are very much under-tuned upon release, hell, Azir was borderline unplayable due to his myriad of bugs (many which are still around might I add).

However, they have a kit that FITS them. Even when I did badly as either of them (and with Sion, REALLY badly), it was still satisfying, it was still fun. With this Cassiopeia, it's unfun even when I do well.

Notice how Sion is a tanky heavy-weight juggernaut in both identity and gameplay. How Azir is a horribly squishy soldier-reliant emperor who stands at the back (a bug preventing his soldiers from attacking when they're too close practically enforces that lmao), and his gameplay reflects that.

Now notice how Cassiopeia's kit doesn't fit her at all as I explained before.


> if the changes are dramatic they can really cause some of these sorts of problems.

The reason many people want her rework reverted isn't because they were 100% content with her old kit. It was flawed in multiple areas too! However, they want it reverted to get as far away from this rework as possible with Cassiopeia.

Hence, why she NEEDS to have many more overhauls. If the prospect of reverting the rework is just plain impossible, then the next best course of action is simply to do whatever it takes to make her as different as possible from the mess she is now.

So that she isn't a **hyper-carry** anymore.
So that she doesn't revolve around her E.
So that she will have powerful AoE again rather than being the **single-target mage** she currently is.
So her Passive...is better.

{{champion:268}} 

Why on earth do you have him under a rework?
The rework was referring to Sion. The plural s is auto-correct.

> Yeah I really worry about this. I want to keep improving the champion where possible, but, if the changes are dramatic they can really cause some of these sorts of problems.

So uh, if I can, since I just re-read this....

People seem to *want* dramatic changes in the vein of "Noxious Blast is the best skill" instead of "Twin Fang is the only skill" that the rework currently promotes.

> I hope you stick with her through the changes, and I'll try to make any further changes laser-focused so as to fix problems without causing this sort of upheaval. Thanks for giving the update a chance!

But we **want** that upheaval. We want it to **go back to the way it was**.

Reworks shouldn't drastically change the way a champion plays unless it really is a full-blown redo of the champion (Soraka, Sion). Cassiopeia still has **four** of her five effects being the same, though numerically adjusted such that two of them seem to exist to force the player to both have skill and to enable one of those remaining ones.

I mean, you **from an absolute objective standpoint** nerfed 60% of Cassiopeia's kit so you could buff 20% of it absurdly and let that last 20% serve to make her gated by time pressure.

imo-- No numbers need to be analyzed there, since you just shifted her focus from "AoE Poison" to "Single target DPS vs poisoned".

The problem is that that 60% of her kit was the reason people played Cassiopeia. They really loved how it worked.

Like how the people that play AP Kog'Maw just want to Bio-Arcane Barrage. Over. and over. and over... And they have fun with that. They're **not** playing optimally and **they know and are OK with that**. They're **having fun** in a **game**.

The rework prevents **the people that liked Q/W Cassiopeia play** which required managing Deadly Cadence (re: using 60% of kit) **can no longer have fun doing this** because they **feel absolutely worthless**.

We can **numerically** but not **conceptually** show that.

We want **conceptually* a mage that focuses on **poisoning things**-- not a mage that **focuses poisoned things**. Do you see and understand the difference?

Twin Fang, Cassiopeia's E, 20% of her kit, was JUST THAT.

20% of her kit. The _optimal_ 20%.

But lots of people didn't play her optimally and knew they weren't playing her optimally. And she was reworked anyway... into something that they couldn't have fun with.

And now they are mad because they can't have fun.

So... to you, Stashu:

#It is only a game. Why do you have to leave your players mad? Give them what they want (since they already had it) or explain *extremely thoroughly* why they can't have it. These people want a thing, but you don't give a straight answer. They would be best able to understand your perspective, **IF AND ONLY IF** you give to them \_what it is that you think\_ in both high-level thought (say, the design goals) and in layman's terms ("since we want Cass to do X... we gave her Y... we want her to do X because Z...").

That, in my opinion, is the way to make sure your players know what YOU want.

That is the way to make sure the PLAYERS know what WILL NOT happen. That makes this very CLEAR WHAT IS TO BE

AND WHAT IS NOT TO BE.

... I'm going to just go to bed now because things start falling apart when I start referencing Shakespeare plays I haven't read or watched.

Good old Stashu, listening to the one player that likes what you're doing instead of the dozens that despise it.

If all you're going to do is laser-focus on implementing shit we still don't want, I'm just going to demand a refund on my Cass skin and Cass herself, cause I'd never want to play her again. I'm already considering it; this is not the champion I paid for, not even remotely, and I am a VERY dissatisfied customer.

Thankfully I can just play Infinite Crisis instead. They have a better Cass than League, now.
Oh, who's their poison champ? I played it a while ago but if they have a solid DoT/poison champ, I'd consider picking it back up, since you know... The one I really enjoyed is gone.

They released Star Girl recently, she's largely a DoT mage. A few differences from Cass, though.

-Her Q is a line skillshot
-Her W requires line of sight with her target
-Her E is a slow AoE+damage increae
-Her DoT stacks with the Cosmic Staff item effect DoT
-Her ulti is a close-range DoT that prevents movement effects and gives her a shield for each damage tick.

She's not quite as active as Cass was, but evokes a lot of the same playstyles: she's a bit of a bully but very, very squishy and has no real escapes of her own.

> >I really want to try and master her but it just feels as if there's no point if she's just going to keep being changed.
> 
> Yeah I really worry about this. I want to keep improving the champion where possible, but, if the changes are dramatic they can really cause some of these sorts of problems.
> 
> I hope you stick with her through the changes, and I'll try to make any further changes laser-focused so as to fix problems without causing this sort of upheaval. Thanks for giving the update a chance!

If you want to improve Cass, abandon your rework and revert it.

If you're so obsessed with your stupid fucking stack passive, make a new champion that nobody will play because it's a terrible idea.

> stupid fucking stack passive

whoa there...I probably hate the rework as much or even more than anyone, but don't scare him away...

At this point, it seems the most likely scenario is to scare him away. He's made it clear he's not interested in working with the community. Instead, he cherry-picks comments that support him, or at least enable him to continue pushing the stacking passive while ignoring any hard criticism or suggestions on what Cassiopeia needs to get her identity back.

If he leaves the rework to someone more cooperative, then something could get done. The past three months have done nothing but prove that Stashu is the main obstacle in getting Cassiopeia in to a good place.

Or much more likely...we scare him away from the forums, but not the rework. Meaning it goes on without any input and Stashu powers through with this train wreck of a rework still not knowing what his rework's problems are.

> Or much more likely...we scare him away from the forums, but not the rework. Meaning it goes on without any input and Stashu powers through with this train wreck of a rework still not knowing what his rework's problems are.

It's already going in without any of our input.

That is...depressingly true.

Well, okay, no. He does have inputs, only problem is it's often the positive inputs. The bright side is that's *slightly* less the case now than when it was before.

But...yeah. Old threads he makes seems to be abandoned, and it's those old threads where the brunt of feedback and criticisms are found. I think people are starting to realize that and are beginning to just make new topics on the Gameplay+Balance forum instead as those are MUCH more visible and not buried beneath weeks to topics.


So nothing else to do but...continue to TRY AS HARD AS POSSIBLE to get him to realize what's wrong with the rework...

(the answer is many things, but I'd like to focus on her [E being the entire damn kit](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/E1kLKJaz-stashu-have-you-ever-considered-making-cassiopeia-not-revolve-around-twin-fangs-e) ... )
Did you even read the OP?

So get the major changes out of the way, so people can re-adjust ASAP, tweak from there.

This is not an excuse not to make changes, this is quite the opposite. Why let people get used to something nobody wants to stick around?

And for the record, I gave the rework a chance, and it's not enjoyable. It took everything I enjoyed about Cassiopeia and trashed it in favor of spamming E until my middle finger falls off. 

I've tried this new rework, multiple times, including the pbe iteration, and it's **not Cassiopeia**.

This statement is the most disturbing I've ever seen you make. It just proves that you have no interest in restoring Cassiopeia's identity and instead that you only desire to cling to the perversion of her that you prematurely pushed to Live.

I don't care what Scampy says about you trying to make progress, I don't see it and you disgust me.

Tried playing Cass again.

Felt like shit, couldnt duel a stunned kassadin that i then exhausted.

Great fucking rework. Really brilliant.

If I can boil down one point for Stashu, it'd be this.

"Cassiopeia's kit does not feel good by parts."

In comparison... Let's use Anivia since she has a similar interaction-- setup and then E.

Anivia's Q, W, and R all feel VERY nice **alone**. Her E does feel only *meh* alone and feels **great** when used to follow up Q/R.

Cassiopeia's Q and W basically serve no purpose other than to allow Cassiopeia to escape or to enable E.

Cassiopeia's E, however, does a lot less damage-per-cast than Anivia's E. It has a much lower cooldown (0.5 v 4 iirc), and doesn't do **that** much less damage (I think 2.5 Twin Fangs = 1 Frostbite but I'm not sure). But the player must continually... hit... a button.

And after each button press, they have to move. And make sure that their enabler didn't run out. etc etc

#Players want, simply, **some power without ever having to press the E button on their keyboard**.

Stashu compared Cassiopeia's Miasma to Trundle's Pillar of Ice-- they have roughly the same slow!

Except Pillar of Ice creates Terrain. Miasma does not. In exchange for not creating Terrain, Miasma gets the ability to deal damage.

However, Miasma also starts out in a smaller AoE than Pillar of Ice-- it grows to slightly larger than Pillar of Ice's size... over the duration of 7 seconds.

And the Miasma damage is low unless you use Twin Fangs after it.

Noxious Blast is a skillshot that you have to hit very reliably in order to play Cassiopeia.

Alone, it's basically worthless.

**Name a champion in this game that has more than one ability that has almost no impact unless some other thing is true *even after hitting that ability* **(and thus having been in range to hit it)**-- I'll wait.**

[The only champion I can think of is Yasuo, but his Q/E both have INSANELY short cooldowns so the fact that they're low-impact-per-cast doesn't matter since they have a 6->1.33 and 0.5->0.1 second cooldown respectively-- you get to use both a lot if you plan well, and don't have to worry about hitting each time-- Cassiopeia DOES.

And in laning-- Yasuo needs some weakpoint, yeah? Yeah.]

> I think she'll be very, very strong in the right matchups. Like, holy shiet you have no idea. That poison amp on Twin Fang is so strong if you use it right and it's actually way more fun to manage than you'd think. A late game hyperscaling champ that can all-in you at level 3 with Q-E-E-Q-Ignite for a kill from near full HP? That's not supposed to happen.

I don't care. I don't care I don't care I don't care I don't **CARE**. Buff her numbers into the stratosphere, make her FP/ban every competitive match, nerf her rivals into oblivion, fine, sure. You might get a lot of people to pipe down, but only those who were never really thinking this through. **It's not about STRENGTH.**

How many times must this be said? How long do people (Stashu included) intend to ignore the most fundamental flaw of this rework? **This champion we have right now simply fails to match the *character* of Cassiopeia.**

Who Cassiopeia is: Subtle, seductive, manipulative, opportunistic, observant, calculating, crafty, ruthless, unscrupulous, cursed, venemous.

What Cassiopeia feels/plays like right now: Patient, ascending, energetic, aggressive, flashy, brawly.

Sure, pre-rework Cass had problems. Lane bully, weird passive/E/ult considering her character, yadda yadda. Fine, she could have benefited from a rework. However, this rework **doesn't actually fix anything** except for making her strictly weaker in lane. I don't understand why it's acceptable that this skirmish-oriented and spam-happy bully is what we're currently calling Cass. Even if she is strong, don't you think there's a problem?

Why is all of her power still on her E? Why is she embracing the curse by being an overt-but-weak bully until she just gets to kill things? **Why is this kit okay?** Because I seem to be one of like maybe 5 people total saying that it's not.

I hope you read on to the part where I agree with you.

>Just remember that her being strong doesn't mean she's in a great place. There's still a ton of room for improvement.

Which is then followed by saying her passive, and kit in general, is basically fine. You say there's still room for improvement, but give every indication that minor tweaks and buffs would be enough. They're not.

Edit: Let me clarify why it looked so much like you thought this kit was fine.
> What's important to remember is that this isn't about getting the entire rework reverted, or getting Stashu removed from the rework, or proving who was right all along about what identity fits Cass the best.

If Cass fans think that this kit is *fundamentally unsatisfying*, then this rework needs big changes. Stashu so far has proven absolutely unwilling to actually make any big changes, and has further proven unable to understand Cass's identity or fantasy.
> The passive is still a snake in her boot, so to speak, but if Stashu's latest posts on the subject have been any indication, it sounds like we'll be getting an actual gameplay passive to go along with the current one, or maybe even multiple gameplay passives that you unlock as you stack up. We may even see some Petrifying Gaze tweaks and totally awesome Miasma buffs in the package.

So far, all we've read has been about relatively small changes. A passive that grants slightly different forms of power and hyper-scaling is not a big change, simple buffs don't address the problem, and I've yet to actually see anything about changing her ult.
She also feels monotonous. She should have something to 'adapt' strategy, since she's a clever one. The Anivia comparison nails the explanation [W].
If anything her new kit is more flexible than the old

> If anything her new kit is more flexible than the old

Her old kit had more damage on her Q/W which makes it more flexible for damage purposes

Her old kit had lower Q/W cooldowns which makes it more flexible because you can do more casts

I don't think your argument is valid.

True for the damage, while Q&W got nerfed they buffed E's damage AND added utility to it.
Speaking of utility usefullness Q's cd is now 4 seconds up from 3. They even nerfed the MS boost for the first two ranks. W's is now 14 seconds, 10 at rank5, up from the constant 9. Also, who cares for the stronger slow anyway? I could argue that with her passive these cooldowns get even lower than before (and if you have 5% CDR from the Masteries, you'll only need an item that gives 10% to cap it) but to reach it, you'd either have to farm, or harass consistently till mid-game.

Can't agree with you at all, sorry.

Katarina has been my main since I started. Her rework pissed me off, but it wasn't even remotely as bad as this nonsense. Stashu has been nothing but a stubborn idiot throughout this "process." 

I'm with the others on this. IDGAF if the newest changes make her stronger if all that strength is in thr least fun part of her kit. It feels like shit to play her. She's even more PvE than most champs in lane and has a rotation that makes hotkey MMOs from the early 2000s look exciting by conparison.

She is shit. Total shit. A bif steaming pile of shit. Cass **is** dead. She needs to be revived and Stashu is not the one to do it.

Managing Deadly Cadence was fun.
Zone control with W was fun.
Hitting Qs and following up with Es for supplemental (NOT primary) damage was fun.
Hitting Qs to poke my target down at range or push hard was fun.


Waiting 40 minutes to be useful is not fun.
Farming for 40 minutes is not fun.
Farming with E and getting murdered cause im overextending to do so is not fun.
Having to hit 4 or 5 skills to trade (not even duel, just trade) is not fun.
Single target close range DPS on a super squishy is not fun. 
Being an AP version of an ADC is not fun (unless you scale multiplicatively, ie with AoE damage a la Vlad, Azir, Morde, Karthus. Notice all the late game APCs are AoE ppwerhouses. AoE is the AP version of crits. No/bad AoE=no multiplicative scaling=bad carry by design. No amount of tweaking will change that.)

The reworked Cass is not fun and never will be. Not until you wise up and murder that passive, put the focus back on Q and abandon any single target lategame carry ideas you've ever had. Unless you want Twin Fangs to crit, she will never work in the way you want her to. Even if it did, it would still feel like shit to play.

> Just remember that her being strong doesn't mean she's in a great place. There's still a ton of room for improvement.

What I meant was that while the next iteration might be strong, don't get complacent and accept the rework just because it's powerful, because it's a loooooooong way from where it needs to be. Did this message not get through? It's sounding like people are writing comments before reading the whole post, or maybe I just wasn't specific enough.

Frankly I'd rather her not be strong in this iteration. It'd just give Stashu the "see guys, shes fine now" excuse to stop working on her. She'd remain shit, but they'd be able to say its fine cause she's competitive, doesnt matter if she isnt fun.

I want Cass, not shit. But I'm not convinced Riot isnt perfectly okay with shit if itd winrate/pickrate is decent and its not "toxic," even if its as fun as watching paint dry.

> Frankly I'd rather her not be strong in this iteration. It'd just give Stashu the "see guys, shes fine now" excuse to stop working on her. She'd remain shit, but they'd be able to say its fine cause she's competitive, doesnt matter if she isnt fun.
>

I cannot find the other thread about her, but I did not get the chance to offer my own opinions about the champion. Here are my opinions.

I have several issues with Casseopia. I may not be as helpful as some of these other players in this thread, but I used to play her a lot before I moved on to other champions. My issues with Casseopia are the following:

1)	She has a passive that is only useful the more enemies she has poisoned. When she finally gets to the passive stacks they are underwhelming. From what I can tell the passive only stacks on enemy champions. Getting 400+ stacks on enemy champions hardly ever happens.
2)	All of Casseopiaâ€™s abilities are easily dodgable. Her Q ability can be run past. Her W ability can be dodged just by moving around it. How is a player supposed to poison enemies with abilities that are easily dodgable? That is the problem.  I think she is a lot like Karthus, who I think also has problems with his abilities in terms of hitting enemy champions. At least Karthus has decent range on his abilities and they can be used to place it strategically. Unfortunately he suffers the same fate as Casseopia does with the Q ability.
3)	Her Q ability was changed recently. There is a longer cooldown on it and the cast range was changed. Her Q ability is basically useless now.
4)	I do not feel like her current abilities and special ability truly capture the essence of the character. I was so excited to read about Casseopia because she reminded me of a Disney villain. When I got to playing her she did not feel right for the character. I thought Casseopia was going to be a champion that was sneaky and only went in for the kill when the opportunity called for it. When I first saw Casseopia I envisioned her being able to summon snakes to fight for her.
5)	Casseopia has no sustainability. Her ultimate can be used to escape from fights but that has a long cooldown and can only be used in a few situations.
Changes I think need to be done and own ideas:
1)	Get rid of the special ability. The community has even told you, they do not like the special ability. If there was a way to have her abilities hit the enemy champion then I could see the passive idea working. Unfortunately the problem is her abilities are all dodgable, and worse than Karthus. If you are so intent on keeping this passive stacking special ability, you need to fix her abilities then.
2)	I do not know why but I kind of feel like her ultimate would be a good ability. The part that applies a stone effect on enemies should be removed, but it would be nice to have an ability that gives her an opportunity to move back or escape from a fight. It needs to be tweaked and edited but that is just my idea about it. She should get an ultimate that does something else for her and not force players to wait for it on cooldown. Casseopia is slow and it sucks to have to wait for her ultimate if it is on a long cooldown. There are so many possibilities you can do with this character, and this is what we get? There is no imagination.
3)	The most useless ability for me is her Q. I detest abilities that go over the mouse cursor. They are slow and have a really limited cast range on them. Players can simply just run away from it, even if you try to place it strategically in front of their path. The ability is useless in range and usability. I kind of want to see her E in place of her Q. The new Q should apply poison to enemies but also do more damage on enemies that are already poisoned. The damage on it should be adjusted but that would be something more useful than what she has now. She needs to have at least one ability that can poison an enemy. The Q should be changed regardless.
4)	To be completely honest I do not feel there is anything wrong with her W ability, but the fact that he Q ability is also dodgable is why I am mentioning it. Either her Q or W needs to go and be replaced with something that can at least poison one enemy. Even if you try to strategically place it, enemies can still dodge it.
